intro: Palicourea andrei, commonly known as the yellow palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Palicourea andrei is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
